comments:
Around line 707, in the method of doPublish() there is a try/catch that simply
return a null IStatus, if Exception is thrown when the delegate.publish() is
called. 

The ServerBehaviour method can be overridden by third-party plugin. It worth to
be more defensive here, and would be great if we can report this
RuntimeException as an Error Status.

The null pointer is not expected in many case. For example, we got the following
as a NPE from WTP WebService code.

server.publish(IServer.PUBLISH_CLEAN,  monitor) returns a null which causes this
NPE.



--------- side note ---------
Around line 694, the method of publish() is the caller of doPublish().

There is an empty catch block that return null IStatus. The catch block is very
not likely to reach, because both methods has similar try/catch block already.
It can probably be removed.
Fixed and tagged for weekly I-build.
Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months. If this problem has not been verified or you still have problems, please open a new bug.
